title: Coastal Wild Swimming Trail
suitableFor: Confident swimmers comfortable in open water, aged 16-55, with a good level of fitness for short coastal walks and moderate swimming challenges.
notSuitableFor: Non-swimmers, individuals with limited mobility, those with a fear of heights or open water, or young children under 16 without significant prior experience.

stops.title: Coasteering at Abereiddy Blue Lagoon
stops.description: Explore the dramatic coastline and jump into the Blue Lagoon with MUUK Adventures. Scramble, swim, and leap your way along the rugged cliffs.

wetAlt.title: National Wool Museum
wetAlt.description: Learn about the history of Welsh wool production in a beautifully preserved mill.

budgetAlt.title: Free swim at Whitesands Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a less challenging, but equally beautiful, swim in the waves at Whitesands.

stops.title: The Sloop Inn
stops.description: A traditional pub in Porthgain harbour serving hearty Welsh fare and fresh seafood.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Porthgain Harbour
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own picnic overlooking the picturesque harbour at Porthgain.

stops.title: Secret Coves Swim near St Davids
stops.description: Discover hidden coves and secluded beaches along the St Davids peninsula for a more tranquil wild swimming experience.

wetAlt.title: St Davids Cathedral
wetAlt.description: Explore the historic cathedral and learn about its significance in Welsh history.

budgetAlt.title: Coastal walk along the Pembrokeshire Coast Path
budgetAlt.description: Hike a section of the stunning coastal path and enjoy panoramic views.

stops.title: St Davids YHA
stops.description: A modern hostel in the heart of St Davids, ideal for budget-conscious travellers and groups.

budgetAlt.title: TYF Cliff-top Campsite
budgetAlt.description: A scenic campsite overlooking the coast near Porthclais harbour.

stops.title: Wild Swimming at Barafundle Bay
stops.description: Immerse yourself in the turquoise waters of Barafundle Bay, often voted one of the best beaches in the UK.

wetAlt.title: Pembroke Castle
wetAlt.description: Visit the impressive Pembroke Castle, birthplace of Henry VII.

budgetAlt.title: Free swim at Barafundle Bay
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy the beautiful scenery and calm waters of Barafundle Bay with a relaxing swim.

stops.title: Stackpole Inn
stops.description: A popular pub near Stackpole Quay serving delicious food and local ales.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Stackpole Estate
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic lunch amidst the beautiful grounds of Stackpole Estate.

stops.title: Paddle Boarding at Stackpole Quay
stops.description: Enjoy a relaxing paddle boarding session around Stackpole Quay with Outer Reef Surf School.

wetAlt.title: Carew Castle
wetAlt.description: Explore the ruins of Carew Castle and its tidal mill.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Stackpole Estate on foot
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a walk through Stackpole Estate, visiting the lily ponds and coastal paths.

stops.title: Stackpole Centre (National Trust)

budgetAlt.title: Broadhaven Camping

stops.title: Coastal Walk and Swim at Freshwater West
stops.description: Hike along the dramatic coastline of Freshwater West, known for its powerful waves and unique rock formations, finishing with a swim.

wetAlt.title: Hangar 5 Trampoline Park

budgetAlt.title: Free swim at Freshwater West
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy the powerful waves and dramatic scenery of Freshwater West with a free swim.

stops.title: Runwayskiln
stops.description: A cafe and pottery studio near Marloes Sands, serving delicious lunches and cakes.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Marloes Sands

stops.title: Guided Wild Swimming Session

wetAlt.title: Milford Haven Museum

budgetAlt.title: Relax on Marloes Sands
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy the peace and tranquility of Marloes Sands with a swim and sunbathe.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Pembrokeshire weather is unpredictable. Pack for all conditions, even in summer. Sea temperatures are usually cool, around 14-17Â°C in summer. Check tide times before swimming.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy in peak season, especially around St Davids and Tenby. Parking can be challenging, arrive early or use park and ride schemes where available. The A40 is prone to congestion.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Book guided activities and accommodation well in advance, especially for summer months. Some campsites require pre-booking.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This trip requires a moderate level of fitness. Be prepared for short coastal walks, swimming in open water, and potentially some scrambling over rocks.
